title: New client not working; old client working fine
body:
I decided to play League for the first time in a month or so today.  I found that when I tried to log in (on the "new" client), the client bugsplatted.  It repeated this a couple times, and I cannot find a "repair installation" option in the new client's login page to try to fix things that way.  I then switched to the "old" client, and it is working fine.

From what I can tell, the bugsplat hits after authentication succeeds, during the time the login area says "Loading..."

replies.body: Bugsplats usually happen when drivers or bad game files fail to render, so it sounds like the installation didn't run properly for your updated client.  Some functions aren't available yet like repairs or the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), so a [reinstall ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) would be necessary in this case.  Let me know if you have any questions!

Can I reinstall the new client alone without disturbing the core game files (since those are evidently working fine)?  I'd rather not have to do a 13GB download or whatever it is these days to get back to using the buggier and slower new client.

Unfortunately, not yet.  Until we can get our HRT and other tools compatible, a total reinstall would be the best fix.  Trying to preserve files will just confuse the patcher and cause you to loop into scanning your game files for corruption.
